content: a friends and fellow crafters welcome to the craft DM Scotty here today we're
going to do a lizard camp but I was working on it for my game and I wanted
to add some objects that would give some flavor to the camp so I did a few
different objects and we're going to do that in this video so let's hit the
table and start working on that lizard man camp
hey guys I want to make a lean-to so I scored some cardboard to make it look
like boards distressed the edge a little bit and then put a coffee stick across
as a support so now I'm gonna add some detail on here with the glue gun I want
to I want these to look like rough boards right and the same with the
toothpicks he's gonna be a stands for the lean-to but I want the toothpicks to
be a bit rough not just the nice hewn wood that you might find in a more
civilized quotation mark settlement so I'll just put that on there get those
already and those rough those up a little bit so they're just not totally
nice looking look more like sticks okay now I'm gonna start gluing them on so
just hold it for a few until the hot glue sets and do the other side and
these will make some great lien twos so now I'm gonna reinforce house a little
bit with some extra hot glue blend it in make sure you blend it in ice okay now I
want to make the base so I'm gonna use some thin cardboard and just trace
around my lean-to here and cut it roughly out
and then I'll just glue it on there with the hot glue looking good just hold it
for a sec then I'm gonna start filling in the base a bit because I want to make
I want to make it look like rough ground and not just to be scarred bored right
and I'll just add some extra glue to make sure it's secure on the base there
we go nice and rough make those posts look
like they're stuck into the ground clip the excess off add a little dab on the

it's not just flat cardboard right it'll have some texture on it just pull the
hot glue gun across the top there we're going to add another detail so I'm not
too concerned with it now I'm going to cover up the corrugations of the
cardboard with the edge of the hair that's typical hot glue gun looking good
looking good all right now I've got some pencil
shavings and I love these I love using these pencil shavings so I've just got
some 50% glue 50% water and I'm gonna soak it saturate the pencil shavings
with the glue and water get it to a nice slushy consistency blend it up with your
brush make sure you don't let the glue dry on the brush now I'm gonna add some
of this slush to the base and then I'm going to add most of it to the back of
the lean-to because I want to look kind of like you know they they would be
close to the earth and I want to kind of look like you know growing moss you know
on this lean-to so I thought that'd be really cool to do that with this with
the pencil shavings the slushy of pencil shavings there we go just apply it and
we'll let it dry up cool I will move on to the next project
hey crafters I thought it might be nice to add some extra details to the
Lizardman camp and I came up with this totem right so the head I just cut out a
foam core and then added the details with a ballpoint pen I stuck a toothpick
through it to give it some support the base the log is just a smaller size
toilet roll that I sized and glued together
then I covered it with glue soak toilet paper and let that dry then I added some
details with the points on the bottom there with some craft foam just some
throwaway craft foam and the moss there is just from pencil shavings so the
bottom here I just covered I just used a washer and covered it with hot glue so
that gave a nice sturdy base and keeps it upright I thought it might be do nice
to do like a drying fishing rack too so I cut these little neat little fishies
out of paper and then did a similar thing that I did with the lean-to with
the toothpicks and just made a frame that I could glue hot glue the fish to
like they're drying so I thought that was pretty cool once everything is dried
up I'm going to use a flat black spray paint to come to black bond them cover
them all up and then after that I'll paint on a dark brown burnt umber to all
the pieces to give it a nice Brown base coat right so here what I'm gonna do is
add a lighter brown to the structure here and I'll just paint that on and I'm
going to use a even lighter round right on top of the wet so it kind of blends
in a little bit together gives a nice effect so here we go I've got the totem
now and doing the same kind of thing just so just a kind of a witty brown and
once I get that painted on I'll use the lighter brown kind of as a highlight but
I'm just gonna mix it right into the wet paint so pretty cool gives a nice effect
all right looking good looking good all the details coming out very cool all

then on the top of the lean-to nice nice all right now what I'm gonna

here we are at my table on game night and here's a little island I did for the

accent to the camp I think some nice detail just super cheap to make really
easy I can see the moss on the side nice accent so really cool really cool it's
so she just made out of junk and I think it adds a really nice accent then the
fish drying rack another little nice accent basically just lobs of hot glue
on a piece of paper glued to this you know this rack and just the rack is just
toothpicks with some hot glue on to make them look like rough sticks and just a
really nice little thing that you can add to the camp
give it some personality and then the lean-to is they were just really easy
and super cheap to make take a closer look here at the moss on the ground
there the sticks holding it up on the back I really love the pencil shaving
technique because unlike traditional flocking where it can come off
everywhere and be in your boxes in your table this stuff isn't going to go
anywhere it's actually gonna give strength to the piece so I really like
that glue pencil shaving technique and it really does give the look of kind of
a moss so really cool and easy to do there you go I hope you enjoyed this
look at the Lizardman camp have fun hey crafter I hope you really enjoyed
the video if you did give your DM Scottie a thumbs up I'd really
